Cloud computing is the delivery of computing services over the internet, which allows users to access and use resources such as servers, storage, databases, networking, software, analytics, and intelligence from anywhere at any time. Cloud computing services are typically categorized into three types: Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and Software as a Service (SaaS). The benefits of cloud computing include cost savings, scalability, flexibility, and disaster recovery. It enables organizations to quickly scale their IT resources as needed and only pay for what they use.

Private Cloud: A private cloud is a cloud computing environment that is dedicated solely to one organization. It is usually managed either by the organization itself or by a third-party service provider. The infrastructure and services are not shared with other organizations, offering greater control, security, and customization options. Private clouds are typically used by large enterprises or organizations with specific compliance or security requirements. They offer benefits such as improved security, compliance with regulatory standards, and customizable infrastructure.

Public Cloud: A public cloud is a cloud computing environment that is hosted and managed by a third-party service provider and made available to multiple organizations or individuals over the internet. The infrastructure and resources are shared among multiple users, offering scalability, flexibility, and cost-effectiveness. Public clouds are accessible to anyone who wants to use them and are often used for general-purpose computing needs such as web hosting, development, and testing. They provide advantages like reduced costs, no need for hardware maintenance, and easy scalability.

Hybrid Cloud: A hybrid cloud is a computing environment that combines elements of both private and public clouds. It allows organizations to leverage the benefits of both environments by integrating on-premises infrastructure with public cloud resources. This integration enables data and applications to be dynamically moved between the two environments based on changing workload demands, security requirements, and cost considerations. Hybrid clouds offer greater flexibility, scalability, and customization options compared to using either private or public clouds alone. They are commonly used by organizations that want to retain control over sensitive data while taking advantage of the scalability and cost-effectiveness of public cloud services.

CAD stands for Computer-Aided Design. It is the use of computer software to facilitate the creation, modification, analysis, or optimization of a design. CAD software is commonly used in various industries for creating detailed 2D drawings and 3D models. It enhances precision, productivity, and communication in design processes.
OnShape is a cloud-based CAD platform that allows teams to collaborate on designing products in real time.
OnShape is a cloud-based CAD platform that allows teams to collaborate on designing products in real time.
You can use OnShape by signing up for an account, creating a new document, and starting your design using its powerful CAD tools.

onshape_patterns.pattern: what are the benefits of using onshape\??
responses: Using OnShape offers benefits like real-time collaboration, version control, and access from any device with an internet connection.
OnShape supports collaboration by allowing multiple users to work on the same document simultaneously, with changes being updated in real-time.

onshape_patterns.pattern: what file formats does onshape support\??
responses: OnShape supports various file formats including STEP, IGES, STL, and many others for import and export.
Yes, OnShape uses industry-standard security measures to protect your data, including encryption and regular security audits.

onshape_patterns.pattern: what are cad tools in onshape\??
responses: CAD tools in OnShape include features for 2D sketching, 3D modeling, assembly, and drawing creation, among others.

onshape_patterns.pattern: how do i get started with onshape\??
responses: To get started with Onshape, create an account on their website, explore the tutorials, and begin a new project by creating a document.

onshape_patterns.pattern: how do i collaborate on designs in onshape\??
responses: You can collaborate by sharing your Onshape document with team members, allowing them to edit or view the design in real time.
Use the 'Share' feature to invite others to your document and set permissions for editing or viewing.

onshape_patterns.pattern: how do i import cad files into onshape\??
responses: Import CAD files by clicking on 'Import' in the Documents page and selecting the files from your computer. Onshape supports formats like STEP, IGES, and STL.

onshape_patterns.pattern: how do i create assemblies in onshape\??
responses: To create assemblies, use the 'Assembly' workspace to bring parts together, using mates to define relationships between them.
Start an assembly by adding parts from your document and using the mate connectors to assemble them.

onshape_patterns.pattern: how do i use onshape on mobile devices\??
responses: Download the Onshape app from the App Store or Google Play to access and edit your projects on the go.
Onshape's mobile app allows you to view, edit, and collaborate on designs from your smartphone or tablet.

onshape_patterns.pattern: how does onshape handle design iterations\??

shapeflow_usage_patterns.pattern: how do i use logs\??|\b(logs)\b|\b(what is logs)\b
responses: To use logs in ShapeFlow, you can import a JSON file containing the logs using upload file function and use the glossary search to find specific data.
ShapeFlow allows you to upload JSON log files using upload file function, which you can then search and analyze using the glossary and graphing tools.

shapeflow_usage_patterns.pattern: how do i upload logs\??|\b(upload logs)\b|\b(how to upload logs)\b
responses: You can upload logs by navigating to the 'Import Logs' section and selecting the JSON file you wish to upload.
To upload logs, click on the 'Upload' button, choose your JSON file, and confirm the upload to import the logs into ShapeFlow.

shapeflow_usage_patterns.pattern: how do i search in the glossary\??|\b(glossary)\b|\b(search in glossary)\b|\b(search glossary)\b
responses: To search in the glossary use the search glossary function , enter your query in the search bar and the relevant data from the imported logs will be displayed.
Use the glossary search feature by typing keywords related to your query, and ShapeFlow will fetch matching data from the logs.

shapeflow_usage_patterns.pattern: how do i see working hours of students during weekends nights and holidays\??|\b(students work hours)\b|\b(students hours)\b|\b(work hours)\b
responses: To view working hours of students during weekends, nights, and holidays, use the working hours function on the log data in ShapeFlow.
Use the working hours function in ShapeFlow to watch weekends, nights, and holidays working hours data.

shapeflow_usage_patterns.pattern: how do i replace a default log\??|\b(replace a default log)\b|\b(replace default log)\b|\b(replace log)\b
responses: Replace a default log by uploading a new log and setting it as the default in the log upload function
To replace a default log, import a new log file and designate it as the default checking the default data source check box.

shapeflow_usage_patterns.pattern: how do i view the new filtered graphs\??|\b(Graphs)\b|\b(view graphs)\b|\b(how to view graphs)\b|\b(how view graphs)\b
responses: To view new filtered graphs use the Graphs function, apply the desired filters such as document, user, log, and time range, then click 'Apply Filters'.
Use the Graphs function to set your filters, including document, user, log type, and time period, and click 'Apply' to generate the graphs.
